Title: Toward a Coordinated Global Observing System for Seagrasses and Marine Macroalgae
Summary: Multiple monitoring methods important for healhy coastal macrophytes. "Inferring drivers of spation connectivity"
Highlights: "algal cultivation has reduced nutrients and resulting algal blooms, including toxic microalgae

Title:
DIVERSITY OF INTERTIDAL MACROALGAE INCREASES WITH
NITROGEN LOADING BY INVERTEBRATES
Highlights: "Slow-growing species tolerant of low nitrogen availability were joined by fast-growing species with higher nitrogen requirements in pools with higher ammonium loading rates."

Title: Final Remarks of Special Issue “Biodiversity of Macroalgae”
Highlights: "Additionally, living macroalgae form sea forests or macroalgal beds that provide habitat and refuge for many other organisms, thereby enhancing local biodiversity"

Title:
Everywhere you look, everywhere you go, there’s an estuary invaded
by the red seaweed Gracilaria vermiculophylla (Ohmi) Papenfuss, 1967
